rename.from: `@media print` throwing an error after upgrading from LESS 4.4.0 TO 4.4.1
rename.to: `@media print` throwing an error after upgrading from LESS 4.4.0 to 4.4.1

body:
<!-- Greeting -->
Hi @kgetz-arista! I'm [Dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot) and I‚Äôm helping the less.js team.

<!-- Answer -->
This error happens because LESS 4.4.1 enforces stricter CSS media query syntax. The parser now requires a space between the media type and the feature, so `@media print(max-width: 992px)` is invalid and should be written as `@media print and (max-width: 992px)`. Without the space and the `and`, LESS emits CSS like `print(max-width: 992px)`, which downstream tools (like lightningcss) interpret as a function call, causing the build to fail with an "Unexpected token Function('print')" error. 

To fix this, update your LESS to use the standard syntax: `@media print and (max-width: 992px)` or `@media (print) and (max-width: 992px)`¬†[reference](https://github.com/less/less.js/issues/4331).


<!-- Dosu Comment Footer -->
*To reply, just mention [@dosu](https://go.dosu.dev/dosubot).*

---

body: Glancing at the changelog for this release, maybe #4349 is the reason for the change in behavior? @puckowski

This issue can be reproduced [using the Less-to-CSS playground](https://lesscss.org/less-preview/#) for version 4.4.1. With Less version 4.3.0, [the output is correct](https://lesscss.org/less-preview/#).

issue.title: fix(issue#4362) no spacing regression for function

labels.name: size:S
labels.description: This PR changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for your interest in the project. I appreciate bugs filed and PRs submitted!
Please make sure that you are familiar with and follow the Code of Conduct for
this project (found in the CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md file).
Also, please make sure you're familiar with and follow the instructions in the
contributing guidelines (found in the CONTRIBUTING.md file).
If you're new to contributing to open source projects, you might find this free
video course helpful: http://kcd.im/pull-request
Please fill out the information below to expedite the review and (hopefully)
merge of your pull request!
-->

<!-- What changes are being made? (What feature/bug is being fixed here?) -->

**What**:

* Fixes #4362 which is a regression introduced by an attempt to create improved and generalized function parsing. Set the no spacing flag for comma separated lists and add test.

Regression caused by https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/4342

<!-- Why are these changes necessary? -->

**Why**:

This Less:

```css
@media print, (max-width: 992px) {
  div {
    color: red;
  }
}
```

throws an error but should be valid.

<!-- Have you done all of these things?  -->

**Checklist**:

<!-- add "N/A" to the end of each line that's irrelevant to your changes -->
<!-- to check an item, place an "x" in the box like so: "- [x] Documentation" -->

- [ ] Documentation
- [x] Added/updated unit tests
- [x] Code complete

<!-- feel free to add additional comments -->

body:
@kgetz-arista Thank you for the bug report. Surprised the tests missed the regression, but this should be resolved by https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/4363

I am short on time today but I'll add more tests to https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/4363 tomorrow and hopefully we can get it merged soon.

issue.title: Release/v4.4.2

labels.name: size:M
labels.description: This PR changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for your interest in the project. I appreciate bugs filed and PRs submitted!
Please make sure that you are familiar with and follow the Code of Conduct for
this project (found in the CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md file).
Also, please make sure you're familiar with and follow the instructions in the
contributing guidelines (found in the CONTRIBUTING.md file).
If you're new to contributing to open source projects, you might find this free
video course helpful: http://kcd.im/pull-request
Please fill out the information below to expedite the review and (hopefully)
merge of your pull request!
-->

<!-- What changes are being made? (What feature/bug is being fixed here?) -->

**What**:

Update files for Release/v4.4.2.
Performed steps from comment on https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/4237:

- Create a branch from master release/v4.4.1
- Bump the Less version. (Unfortunately, this is still clunky, it's changed at package.json in root, and in /packages/less/ for historical reasons)
- Update the Changelog
- Run grunt dist - (Also clunky -- in a perfect world, we would not be committing dist files, but there are also tricky backwards compatibility problems which caused this initially.)
- Commit changed files to branch.
- Submit a PR to this repo.

Also tried to mirror https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/3814

<!-- Why are these changes necessary? -->

**Why**:

Fixes https://github.com/less/less.js/issues/4362 which is a regression caused by a more generalized approach to CSS functions.

<!-- Have you done all of these things?  -->

**Checklist**:

<!-- add "N/A" to the end of each line that's irrelevant to your changes -->
<!-- to check an item, place an "x" in the box like so: "- [x] Documentation" -->

- [x] Documentation
- [ ] Added/updated unit tests
- [ ] Code complete

<!-- feel free to add additional comments -->

body: Is this fix going to be released soon? The latest version on npm is still 4.4.1.
@matthew-dean Would you be able to merge https://github.com/less/less.js/pull/4364 release Less ```4.4.2```?
